cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 mi ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest parallel to the northeast Florida coast, then turning north along the Georgia coast toward South Carolina before curving northeast offshore of the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coastal brushing / closest approach near the Georgia coast just east of Savannah

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cocoa Beach FL to Surf City NC (includes the entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida coast, Georgia coast, South Carolina coast, southern North Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Very strong winds possible: 92% chance of ≥34 kt, 61% chance of ≥50 kt, and about 29% chance of hurricane-force winds at the port. Peak winds likely late Friday night into Saturday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge inundation of 6–9 ft above ground level possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance and adjacent estuaries.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts up to 15 inches possible, producing flooding and flash-flood risk in the Savannah area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, isolated tornado potential in rain bands, and possible navigation channel shoaling due to surge and wave action.
